free: #e I am going to tell a story about a boy.
#c 我要講有關一個男孩的故事。
#e The boy, he had a kind heart.
#c 這位男孩，他心腸很好。
#e He kept a dog and a frog as pet.
#c 他養了一隻狗以及一隻青蛙。
#e Everyday, he played with his dog and his frog before going to bed.
#c 每天,他在睡前都與他的狗和青蛙玩耍。
#e His dog was also very happy.
#c 他的狗也非常的高興。
#n 此處 siyo "旁邊"指男孩所看的地方，即青蛙所在之地。
#e When the boy looked at the frog, the dog was also looking at it.
#c 當男孩看青蛙的時候，狗也看著它。
#n nniqan 指 "青蛙所住的地方"。
#e One night, as the boy had slept and the moon had also come out, the frog left its resting place and went outside.
#c 有一天晚上,小男孩睡了,月亮也出來了,這時青蛙從牠原來住的地方跑了出來。
#e At dawn, the boy woke up.
#c 天亮了,小男孩起床了。
#e He looked towards the place where the frog usually stayed, but it had now disappeared.
#c 他往青蛙原本住的位置看去，但青蛙已經不見了。
#e The boy felt very sad seeing this.
#c 小男孩看到這樣感到很傷心。
#e He got dressed and set off to find his frog.
#c 他著裝穿衣準備去尋找那隻青蛙。
#e His dog did not stay idle, and helped him search (for the frog).
#c 他的狗也沒有閒著，也幫忙尋找(青蛙)。
#e Thinking "Where did the frog go?", the dog put its head into the frog’s resting place.
#c 心裡想著：「青蛙倒底去了哪兒呢？」狗將頭探入青蛙的住處。
#e But its head got stuck in the frog’s resting place.
#c 但是牠的頭卻因此卡在青蛙的住處裡面了。
#n kesun 有 "說" 以及 "這樣(做)" 之語意。此處宜譯為後者。
#e No matter how hard the dog tried, it was unable to throw off the rat and the frog’s resting place, the urn.
#c 不管他如何使勁地想把那套在他頭上的青蛙的住屋、一個甕、給拿掉，卻怎麼拿不到，也甩不掉。
#e The boy, on the other hand, did not seem to notice what was happening to his dog. He opened the window and called out to his frog.
#c 小男孩卻也絲毫未察覺地，推著窗往外呼喊著他的青蛙。

gloss: 使役-放掉-受焦.非實現=1IPL.主格

free: #e As the dog was busy taking off the urn from its head, it fell down from the window.
#c 而狗兒也一不小心，只想說擺脫這甕就好了，竟從窗戶上跌了下來。
#e The boy was shocked, so he ran out to see if the dog was ok. When he got there, he hugged his dog.
#c 小男孩頓時驚訝得往外頭去，把他的狗兒抱著；
#n 此處 myeha 應為 meyah。
#e The dog was happy to see him and licked his face.
#c 狗兒卻很開心並感恩地舔著他的臉。
#n mddaha 為由 daha "二" 衍生之派生詞。宜譯為 "他們倆" 、 "兩人一起" 等語意。
#e So the boy and the dog set off together to the fields and the forest to find the frog. The boy called, "Frog! Frog!"
#c 就這樣，這隻狗兒就和這個小男孩他們倆一起去田間尋找青蛙，走過森林。「青蛙！青蛙！」這樣喊著。
#e When they saw a small hole, the boy put his head in to see if the frog was there. Instead of finding the frog, the boy’s nose was bit by a field rat.
#c 有一個小洞口，小男孩看到了，便將頭往裡探，卻給田鼠咬了他的鼻子。
#e His dog also tried hard to find the frog.
#c 他的狗兒也很專心地找著青蛙。
#e It shook a very big tree, but did not realize that it had bees in it.
#c 牠晃動一顆很大的樹，但卻沒發現裡面有虎頭蜂。
#e "Frog! Frog!" (the boy) yelled searching for the frog.
#c 「青蛙，青蛙呀！」(小男孩)這麼說著，尋找著青蛙。
#e And the boy climbed the tree, not knowing that his dog was chased by the bees because it shook the tree and made the bee hive fall.
#c 而這個小男孩爬著樹，不知道他的狗兒因搖樹，讓虎頭蜂窩晃落在地正跑著被虎頭蜂追逐。
#e The bees passed by the boy and the boy fell off the tree to the ground.
#c 虎頭蜂經過小男孩的前面；而小男孩從樹上掉落在地上。
#e The crow nearby was shocked seeing this.
#c 在一旁的烏鴉看得都嚇了一跳。
#e "My head hurts so badly!" said the boy, holdin his own head. The crow was watching nearby.
#c 小男孩邊摸著自己的頭邊叫著：「我的頭好痛啊！」烏鴉在旁凝視著。
#e Then, the boy climbed up to a stone, and leaned against something like a branch, calling out to his frog.
#c 接著，小男孩爬到一顆石頭上面，依附在像是樹枝的東西前，呼喊著他的青蛙。
#e The birds were watching nearby, the boy calling out: "Frog! Frog!"
#c 小鳥在一旁看著，小男孩則是「青蛙啊！青蛙！」地呼喊著。
#e The thing that the boy leaned against was actually the horn of a deer rather than a branch.
#c 他依靠著的、扶著的像樹枝狀的東西，原來是隻鹿。
#e The dear was shocked, and started to run, hearing the boy’s voice.
#c 這隻鹿聽到小男孩的聲音，便嚇得跑了起來。
#e The dog saw the deer dragging the boy, so it chased them, and ran to the front.
#c 他的狗兒看到他被那鹿兒拖著，也跑在旁邊直奔到他的前方，
#e However, it did not know that there was a steep slope in the front.
#c 但牠卻不知道前方就是陡坡。
#e Both the boy and the dog fell off the cliff. The deer, who was watching beside, was shocked.
#c 小男孩連同狗兒全都掉落到山崖下去了；旁邊的鹿看著也嚇呆了。
#e (They) fell into the river, which was a deep creek.
#c (他們)掉落到河裡，掉落在深的溪裡；
#e To one’s surprise, the boy was still able to stand up, holding his dog high up.
#c 而那個小男孩竟然還能起來，還將他的狗兒抬起到水面之上。
#e Both of them were very happy, probably because they were not hurt.
#c 兩個都很開心，也許是因為都沒有受到創傷，
#e Then, they swam slowly to one side of the creek where there was a tree.
#c 接著他們便慢慢地游泳到溪邊的樹頭處。
#e The boy said to the dog, "Don’t speak!"
#c 「不要說話。」他對著狗兒說。
#e Both of them climbed up a tree.
#c 兩個一起攀爬上了樹頭，
#e There, they found boy’s frog, which was sitting beside.
#c 在那裡，他們倆找到了男孩的青蛙。牠就坐在旁邊。
#e Both the dog and the boy was really happy seeing this.
#c 狗和小男孩看了都很開心。
#e Many companion frogs were there, too.
#c 那裏也有很多青蛙的同伴。
#e The boy probably thought: "It turns out that he went to look for his friends!"
#c 小男孩也許心裡想著：「原來牠是去找朋友了！」
#n sapah 原意為 "家"、"房子"。加上前綴tn-後，tnsapah為 "家人" 、 "家庭" 之意思。
#e The boy was happy, too, and probably thought "It’s OK! It’s OK! It is with his friends, or maybe family, now!"
#c 小男孩也很開心，心裡可能就想著：「沒有關係！沒有關係！牠現在跟牠的朋友、或是家人在一起了。」
